ratings.comment: Prof Spalding is retired now, but just in case he checks these...you were (and will always be) one of my favorite professors EVER. You saw me in a rough semester and helped me find my passion in science and life again tbh. I'm a better scientist and human for meeting you and I thank you SO much for everything. Hope retirements treating you well :)

Very good professor who cares about his students. His slides were mostly pictures and few words which was hard to follow along with sometimes, but always clarified and answered questions. He genuinely wants everyone to do good and is very passionate about what he teaches. Love this guy.
His enthusiasm is contagious, he really cares about the material he is teaching and the students in his lecture. He frequently check in on students and is always available for help.

Very hard to listen to in lecture. Slides are unorganized and half the time I question if he's even looked at them before class. Contradicted himself often and made it very difficult to learn from in class.

Excellent professor designed a course that teach student to think with an idea of dynamic plant physiological system, which is very helpful for subsequent learning. Lecture might be a little bit confusing as you first exposed to new concept but he is always available to help outside the class. Highly recommended!

As someone who has never taken and biology in their life before this class, I will say that Professor Spalding was sooo helpful. He always makes time for students outside of class and has clear points he makes sure you understand. The class was difficult for myself, but he helped quite a bit. Not the grade I quite want but I can't complain.

I had Spalding for Botany 130. In general the class was pretty easy and Spalding made the learning objectives very clear. Very thorough study guides were given for each exam. He genuinely cares about people.

Amazing professor, he made difficult concepts very easy to understand and he also made it very clear what was going to be on the exams. He is also funny and enjoys teaching about Botany which is nice to have in a professor. His tests were short which gives you plenty of time to think about questions thoroughly.

Professor Spalding is very passionate about what he does & that makes it hard to not also find some interest in what he's saying.  He's funny, genuine, and makes himself very accessible to students.  His teaching style makes difficult content easier to understand & it's clear that he truly wants his students to succeed.

Absolutely amazing professor, I would take literally any course taught by him if I could. His lectures are entertaining, but necessary. As long as you go to lecture you will pass the class and exams with flying colors. He genuinely cares about his students, and there were a couple very easy extra credit opportunities during the semester as well.

Lecture's are very picture- and word-dependent--really listen to what he says during class as that's what you'll be tested on. Exams are 25 MC q's that can be challenging, but really aren't too bad. He is a very knowledgeable and caring professor who really wants to get to know his students. I would definitely take a class with him again!

Prof Spalding is a really amazing person, although his lectures can be fast-paced. He tries to make everything as clear as possible, and often even draws his own diagrams. Bot 130 itself is not an easy class, but the lab quizzes are the hardest. Spaldings exams are science-heavy 25 questions and each is worth 4 points, but its possible to do well.

Professor Spalding is a really sweet person. His lectures can feel fast at times, but he tries to make himself available for questions/help. His class is what solidified that I wanted to pursue botany. Bot130 can feel a little bit demanding if this is your first time going over biology since high school, but the professors and TA offer lots of help

Dr Spalding cares about his students as much as he cares about his plants! He wants each students to succeed, and even amid COVID he tried to be accessible and was always willing to help. He is a very nice guy. His exams are not too difficult. Although, questions on the online exams were worth 4 points and there were 25 of them. Wonderful professor
He really cares about his students and loves botany!

He is a great professor with amazing humor. He kept me awake for an 8:50 class and made things very easy to understand. Overall, very helpful outside of class as well a great teacher. Make sure to keep up with things.

Dr. Spalding is a fun and wacky professor. His lectures are fun to go to and he is really passionate about plants. He is very approachable and will happily answer any questions that you may have in class or during his office hours. The tests can be stressful but if you slow down and think you will do fine. Great Professor!
He is very engaging, knowledgeable, passionate, and cares. He takes the time to help students understand the material.

The exams were really difficult. The powerpoints also have zero words on them, so it can be difficult to go back and study what wasn't clear in lecture. The professor is really approachable though, and answers questions clearly.

Edgar may be the best professor I've had in my four years at the UW. He is a genius, and wonderfully funny. Sincerely cares about his students learning the material that he clearly loves. 10/10 would recommend.

Professor Spalding is a great professor who really knows his stuff! Going to lecture is a must, since a lot of his teaching is done verbally or by writing on the board, but he really made lectures fun to go to. Clearly explains the material and what he expects you to know for the exams. The exams are tough, but study thoroughly and you'll be fine.

Spalding was a great lecturer and I've learned more in his class than I ever have for another class.  I really recommend this class, it can be a bit difficult but if you want to learn the ins and outs of plants it is well worth it.  My favorite science class I've taken.

Professor Spalding is SUCH A GREAT PROFESSOR. He is intentional in his teaching and addresses student concerns in clear and comical ways. He's an old school educator, so he'll likely use the chalkboard (go to class)! He's the reason I went to class at 8:50. His exams test your understanding and application of the material, so know your stuff.
Great Professor!! He is one of my best professors I had so far.

Great professor!  He was super clear with what we were and were not responsible for.  He always was energetic and engaging.  I'm considering taking another one of his classes just to have him as a prof again.

The best professor I had in all of 151 and 152. He was a great professor and went through in detail everything we needed to know. He made the plant unit very interesting. He also does a online chat called the cybergreenhouse where anyone can ask him questions and he posts practice questions there. Very helpful!
Super fine and awkwardly funny in a good way. Breaks things down so they are simple to understand. I considered taking another class just because he was the professor.

Really an awesome professor who made you want to show up to class. Don't forget to check out the Cyber Greenhouse to clarify things! I can't even imagine a person who likes plants more than this guy. I mean, this dude REALLY likes plants. It's endearing, if mildly bizarre (but chalk it up to him being a zany professor, I guess). Would recommend!

Great Professor. EVERYTHING from his test came directly from the lecture. This dude made learning about plants not only tolerable, but actually fun. I considered taking one of his classes strictly because he would be the professor. Great guy, study the lectures.

He was one of the best professors I had. Really helped me obtain a passion for plants. Take him if at all possible. He is pretty easy as long as you go to lecture and maybe skim the book. He has a great personality and you will not regret taking him

I never thought I'd find a series of lectures on plant physiology enjoyable, but Spalding managed to make it so. He's also a very helpful guy, and explains concepts in a way that's clear and easy to understand.

I wasn't planning on being interested in plants while taking this course, but Edgar's enthusiasm and knowledge are contagious. Now, I'm planning on taking more higher level botany courses! A great, entertaining, fair professor!

Spalding is a great lecturer for the plant unit, which would otherwise be pretty boring. His exam is fair, but make sure you understand the material, not just memorize it. His questions make you think, but they are fair.

Very unorganized, doesn't know what he's going to talk about a lot of the time for lecture. When someone asks a question he decides that we can know that information. exam was sort of tricky, not really based off of the lecture totally, some from book.

Great professor! He's seriously a really nice guy. The exam is challenging, but you get to use notes. Make sure you go to class. He writes important things on the board. Also, pay attention to the summary slides at the end of his powerpoints. I mostly studied those and got an A. Really makes plants interesting.

Such a great professor!  I had no interest in plant biology prior to his unit, and came out loving plants!  His test was difficult and really tested how well you knew the copious amounts of material.  But he was awesome and enthusiastic and really wanted you to do well.  Study a lot for the test and you'll be fine.

OK. His exam is challenging because he changes a single word. Also, his ppt slides are full of diagrams (no single words), which means you have to write every single thing he says during the lecture. GOOD LUCK if you are good at taking notes during class. BAD LUCK if you are not so good at taking notes. GOOD LUCK.
Fantastic professor, enjoyable lectures.  Textbook not necessary.  Can get an A with little effort.  Go to class- power points are hard to understand without commentary.

You have to go to lecture.  Most of his lectures are based off of pictures from the book and he writes stuff on the board that wont be on the powerpoints online. His cyber greenhouse is also extremely helpful.  You get the chance to talk with other students in the class as well as the professor himself. Thought provoking tests but not too difficult
So helpful and personable, you can talk to him anytime. Class wasn't that hard, they made a point of not stressing us out. Lectures can be a bit unfocused, but a lot of fun.
Very nice, can go off on tangents a bit, but he knows what he's talking about.

Great prof!! He used virtual office hours (online) and they were awesome. You have to go to his lectures to do well on the test, but seriously-amazing prof. very enthusiastic and interesting!! and gets to know his students

AMAZING. seriously the best professor ever. take him. hes great, you learn a lot and hes really enthusiastic. i hated plants before, and after having him i love them and are going to take a higher level botany. hes the man.
Very enthusiastic and great lecturer.  Attend lecture and you will do well.
AWESOME. Very enthusiastic and a great teacher. Test was tricky, but what gen bio exams aren't?

Very nice guy, but thinks we are all botany majors.  We actually had to measure plants in a lecture, causing a huge line at the end of class.  What a joke.  He puts figures up on the screen and talks about them, sometimes writing two or three words on the board.  Good luck learning from that.  He's kind of full of himself too.
The best prof I've had at the UW... very clear and enthusiastic.  He inspired me to take a higher-level plant physiology class, and I wasn't even interested in botany before this
The best prof I've had at UW!
626.  Excellent class.  This guy really knows his stuff.  A must for the plant sciences!
